title: Ability to import Terminals XML file
author: LoTGoD
body_snippet:
<!-- Feature Request -->
<!-- If you file a feature request, please delete the bug section -->

**I tried importing a Terminals XML file in to mRemoteNG, but keep getting errors about the format of the file:**

---

_InformationMsg 1/18/2017 3:17:17 PM You cannot import a normal connection file. Please use File - Load Connections for normal connection files!_

---

_WarningMsg 1/18/2017 3:17:17 PM You are trying to load a connection file that was created using an very early version of...

comments.snippet: I did it manually, i exported the terminals XML file, opened it in notepad and i created the entry in mRemoteNG one by one :(.
comments.author: dboc

comments.snippet:
> 
> 
> I did it manually, i exported the terminals XML file, opened it in notepad and i created the entry in mRemoteNG one by one :(.

Meh =(. Terminals also supports SQL backend though.. But it takes 5 minutes to start when you're over VPN ≡ƒæÄ
comments.author: mettix

comments.snippet:
Is there still no resolution to this issue?

I too wish to convert from Terminals to mRemoteNG but do not desire to have to recreate the hundreds of RDP sessions.
comments.author: miken89

comments.snippet:
> Is there still no resolution to this issue?
> 
> I too wish to convert from Terminals to mRemoteNG but do not desire to have to recreate the hundreds of RDP sessions.

I switched to the free version of Remote Desktop Manager.  I didn't have any trouble importing the XML.
comments.author: LoTGoD

comments.snippet:
> I switched to the free version of Remote Desktop Manager. I didn't have any trouble importing the XML.

Thanks for the tip for Remote Desktop Manager, but I'd still like to see mRemoteNG update their import ability..
comments.author: miken89
